translations: v．把……比作，把……比喻成：将一个事物与另一个事物相提并论，以便更好地理解或描述。
· She's always likening her problems to those of a character in a book.
她总是把自己的问题比作书中的角色的问题。

sentences.sentence: The Alibaba group's founder and leader is the sharp-featured Jack Ma. Reporters cannot resist likening him to a pixie or an elf.
sentences.translation: 阿里巴巴集团的创始人兼领导者是轮廓鲜明的马云。记者们都禁不住把他比作小仙子或小精灵。

sentences.sentence: Maybe I made a big mistake by likening it to an organic chemistry course--I don't mean to turn you off.
sentences.translation: 也许我把金融市场学跟有机化学进行类比是个很大的错误 - 我并没打算让你们感到厌烦。

sentences.sentence: Maybe I made a big mistake by likening it to an organic chemistry course — I don't mean to turn you off.
sentences.translation: 也许将其比作有机化学课，是个错误，我不是故意想倒你们胃口的。
